meanings.definition: The total mass of red blood cells in the body.
meanings.sent1: The erythron in his body was at a healthy level.
meanings.sent2: Doctors measure the erythron to check for anemia.
meanings.sent3: The erythron decided to throw a party for all the blood cells.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him flowed through her veins like a vibrant erythron.
meanings.sent5: The erythron, like a tiny army, carries oxygen throughout the body.

meanings.definition: The red pigment in red blood cells.
meanings.sent1: The erythron gives blood its distinctive color.
meanings.sent2: The microscope revealed the erythron in the blood sample.
meanings.sent3: The erythron blushed when it realized it was being observed.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks turned as red as the erythron under the microscope.
meanings.sent5: The erythron danced gracefully under the lens, a crimson beauty.
